intro: Andromeda elegans, commonly known as the rosebay witch-hazel, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many acid-loving plants. The plant features narrow, dark green leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring. Its unique floral structure consists of two sets of petals and sepals, and it is pollinated by insects. Andromeda elegans is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in moist, well-drained soils.
